intro: Centropogon stenophyllus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf centropogon, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which are typically fragrant. Centropogon stenophyllus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
